title: Oh! how I long to see that day

verses.text: Oh! how I long to see that day When the redeemed shall come To Zion, clad in white array, Their blissful, happy home.
To hear the allelu-ia roll In cadence sweet and strong, And with a Heaven-enraptured soul To join redemption's song.
To see all Israel safe at home, Singing on Zion's light; And Christ the Lord upon his throne, Creation own its right.
All hail! the morn of glory's high, When Jesus shall we see; That dress the tear from every eyeâ€” Creation's jubilee.
Jerusalem I long to see, Blest city of my King; Oh, when shall I transported be, And hear the blood-washed sing.
My longing heart cries out, Oh, come! Come, Lord Jesus, come to thee; The weary pilgrim sights, Oh, come! Bring immortality.

chorus.text: Oh! bear me on, bear me on To Mount Zion; Oh! bear me on to that city of love, Where Jesus is gone.
